Articles.Content:
Yaaaaay! Downloading meow

how u downloading no link lol and btw sonic how did what i said about clouds come out where they still transparent on v3?

What parts require Texture Replacer? I haven't added this mod and I'm hesitant to do so without serious cause. I'm not sure how many more mods my KSP will handle.

Also, the aliasing in Kerbin atmospheric ascent still remains with the FADEDIST set to different values. It looks very blocky and unnatural for a few seconds until the spacecraft reaches the 35km ceiling.

how u downloading no link lol and btw sonic how did what i said about clouds come out where they still transparent on v3?

I couldn't wait for V3 so I'm downloading V2

What parts require Texture Replacer? I haven't added this mod and I'm hesitant to do so without serious cause. I'm not sure how many more mods my KSP will handle.

Also, the aliasing in Kerbin atmospheric ascent still remains with the FADEDIST set to different values. It looks very blocky and unnatural for a few seconds until the spacecraft reaches the 35km ceiling.

This has been fixed, other than the default atmosphere, which looks a little blocky.

TR is used for the Mun to help with the craters. Nothing else is used for now.

This has been fixed, other than the default atmosphere, which looks a little blocky.

TR is used for the Mun to help with the craters. Nothing else is used for now.

Okay, thanks for the explanation.
One last test of everything, and then the pack will be available.

One last test of everything, and then the pack will be available.

Great news!

I NEED VERSION THREE NOW

But jokes aside, this looks amazing! Great work!

- - - Updated - - -

Never mind, it's here!

Version 3 has been released!

V3 -

Kerbin - Darker Blue Atmosphere around Kerbin. Shading under Volumetrics, and shadows.

Mun - Crisp Mun with a much more realistic glow.

Eve - Dark Purple clouds, with more noticeable atmosphere.(OPTIONAL CONFIG FOR LIGHTER CLOUD COLOR)

Duna - Blue horizon seen from orbit, and blueish surise and sunset. Clouds now have shadows on Duna.

Jool - White and green clouds mixed and balanced better. Atmosphere is a little more noticable(Especially from LJO)

Laythe - New cloud texture for added variety. Shading, and shadows are added too. Atmosphere is more noticeable.

Fixed saving issues
Interesting. Very kewl.
Yaaaaaaaaay! Quick question: if we don't have Texture Replacer, what will happen to the Mun? And how much of Texture Replacer do we need? I haven't downloaded it, I don't know what's in it.

Texture Replacer is neat and worth having around even if you don't plan on swapping out the skybox or anything. For example it makes Kerbals deployed on EVA in breathable atmosphere go out with no helmet, and fun things like that.

Yaaaaaaaaay! Quick question: if we don't have Texture Replacer, what will happen to the Mun? And how much of Texture Replacer do we need? I haven't downloaded it, I don't know what's in it.

It darkens the Mun texture to help the crater appear like they do IRL. It isn't necessary, but doesn't look good without it.
Ahh I see, I understand all now... Just a shame I'm doing some testing at the moment or I'd be lost in space for the next 4 hours Thanks for a great looking pack!

Two questions Thesonicgalaxy. Is this updated to use VE7-2? And .. you say this mod provides a Mun texture to use with TextureReplacer. Im already using Endraxiel's high res Mun texture. Is there anything I should be concerned about there?

Two questions Thesonicgalaxy. Is this updated to use VE7-2? And .. you say this mod provides a Mun texture to use with TextureReplacer. Im already using Endraxiel's high res Mun texture. Is there anything I should be concerned about there?

1)Yes, it's updated for the new EVE 7-2.

2)I'd recommend using mine because it's made for this, but it's perfectly possible to edit Endraxiel's Mun texture to work with the glow.

Can you add the dust stoms into it?

From here.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905-0-23-5-7-1-EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements-NEW!-VolumetricClouds!?p=1070777&viewfull=1#post1070777
I think, with 7-2, you can use both cfgs. Rename the duna one to cloudlayersdunadust.cfg or whatever, then you can put this one in the same folder as well. I THINK... could be very wrong though.

Can you add the dust stoms into it?

From here.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905-0-23-5-7-1-EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements-NEW!-VolumetricClouds!?p=1070777&viewfull=1#post1070777

From earlier -

Little trivia, that pic of Duna was taken with Dust storms on!

Yes, it will use a separate cfg. Simply rename the dust storms cloudLayers.cfg to some like "cloudLayers-Dunaduststorm".
Do you still need help wrangling the RSS config file?

Do you still need help wrangling the RSS config file?

tbh with you, I have no idea what to change in the config file to make it stay that way. I'm not the kinda guy who would know that.
Spaceport download link is broken, it complains about a non-allowed file type.

Spaceport download link is broken, it complains about a non-allowed file type.

Hm, will take it down for now. It doesn't seem to want to accept the zip.

Thesonicgalaxy: Try this:

https://github.com/NathanKell/RealSolarSystem/wiki/AtmosphereFromGround-RSS-Settings

1)Yes, it's updated for the new EVE 7-2.

2)I'd recommend using mine because it's made for this, but it's perfectly possible to edit Endraxiel's Mun texture to work with the glow.

Thank you VERY MUCH.
